title: 128th Problem 2016
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \left( { 100 }^{ 20 } \right) ^{ 5 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"text","text":"expanded","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":". How many "},{"type":"text","text":"digits","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" will you have?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Check out the set: 2016 Problems"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The number of digits "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of a number "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is given by:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} n & = \log_{10} N + 1 \\ & = \log_{10} \left(100^{20}\right)^5  + 1 \\ & = \log_{10} \left(10^{40}\right)^5 + 1 \\ & = \log_{10} 10^{200} + 1 \\ & = 200 + 1 \\ & = \boxed{201} \end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Related Wiki","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":" : "},{"type":"text","text":"Logarithms","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{(100^{20})}^5=100^{100}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Using formula based in logarithms, the number of digits "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=100\times log_{10}100+1=100\times 2+1=\boxed{201}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 128 Zeroes
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the smallest possible value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1\\times 2\\times 3\\times \\dots \\times x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ends with 128 zeroes."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                    "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Relevant wiki: Trailing Number of Zeros","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"From this problem, we want to find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\left\lfloor \frac { x }{ 5 }  \right\rfloor +\left\lfloor \frac { x }{ { 5 }^{ 2 } }  \right\rfloor +\left\lfloor \frac { x }{ { 5 }^{ 3 } }  \right\rfloor +\left\lfloor \frac { x }{ { 5 }^{ 4 } }  \right\rfloor +\dots =128"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A good estimate is essential here."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=300"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\left\lfloor \frac { 300 }{ 5 }  \right\rfloor +\left\lfloor \frac { 300 }{ { 5 }^{ 2 } }  \right\rfloor +\left\lfloor \frac { 300 }{ { 5 }^{ 3 } }  \right\rfloor =60+12+2=74"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=400"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\left\lfloor \frac { 400 }{ 5 }  \right\rfloor +\left\lfloor \frac { 400 }{ { 5 }^{ 2 } }  \right\rfloor +\left\lfloor \frac { 400 }{ { 5 }^{ 3 } }  \right\rfloor =80+16+3=99"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=500"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\left\lfloor \frac { 500 }{ 5 }  \right\rfloor +\left\lfloor \frac { 500 }{ { 5 }^{ 2 } }  \right\rfloor +\left\lfloor \frac { 500 }{ { 5 }^{ 3 } }  \right\rfloor =100+20+4=124"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We need "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" more factor "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"'s, therefore "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=520"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Removing the floor function and using the formula of infinite Gp, also gives a good estimate. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \dfrac{n}{5} + \dfrac{n}{25} + \ldots = 128 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \dfrac{n}{4} = 128 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" n = 512 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" which has 126 zeroes. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
515 will have 127 zeroes, and 520 will have 128 zeroes.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

title: 一道中国高考原题，不服来做

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"we let  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=\sqrt{x+1},b=\sqrt{y+1},c=\sqrt{z+1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T=a+b+c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  ,and   "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S=\sqrt{a^2+1^2}+\sqrt{b^2+2^2}+\sqrt{c^2+3^2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"now consider this graph"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/jdglMq4HKs-1111.png?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AE=\sqrt{a^2+1^2},EF=\sqrt(b^2+2^2),FG=\sqrt(c^2+3^2)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T = AB+BC+CD=AD, and,S = AE+EF+FG"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And then"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S^2-T^2 = (AE+EF+FG)^2-AD^2 \ge AG^2-AD^2=GD^2=36"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"when A,F,G in the same line the inequation holds."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I think Cauchy-Schwarz is way more straightforward: "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned}S^2-T^2&=(S+T)(S-T)\\
&=\bigg[(\sqrt{x+2}-\sqrt{x+1})+(\sqrt{y+5}-\sqrt{y+1})+(\sqrt{z+10}-\sqrt{z+1})\bigg]\bigg[(\sqrt{x+2}+\sqrt{x+1})+(\sqrt{y+5}+\sqrt{y+1})+(\sqrt{z+10}+\sqrt{z+1})\bigg]\\
&=\bigg[(\sqrt{x+2}-\sqrt{x+1})+(\sqrt{y+5}-\sqrt{y+1})+(\sqrt{z+10}-\sqrt{z+1})\bigg]\bigg[\dfrac{1}{\sqrt{x+2}-\sqrt{x+1}}+\dfrac4{\sqrt{y+5}-\sqrt{y+1}}+\dfrac9{\sqrt{z+10}-\sqrt{z+1}}\bigg]\\&\geq (1+2+3)^2\\&=36\end{aligned}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The equality holds when "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{cases}\sqrt{x+2}-\sqrt{x+1}=1\\\sqrt{y+5}-\sqrt{y+1}=2\\\sqrt{z+10}-\sqrt{z+1}=3\end{cases}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Which is accurately "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=y=z=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

replies.body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Kelvin Hong – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" View Yang Daniel's solution, it clearly shows that the minimum occurs at "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{x+1}:\sqrt{y+1}:\sqrt{z+1}=1:2:3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            But it is not trivial right? How to find it?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=y=z=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is NOT a solution. In that case "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S^2-T^2\approx 37.41096"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
Perhaps you meant "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=0, y=3, z=8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"With regards to the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x>0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" comment: if you take "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" infinitesimally greater than 0, you will be able to get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S^2-T^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" arbitrarily close to 36. Close enough to be able to convincingly state that the minimum value of 36 is indeed possible, even though it is reached at the border of the domain."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"As X X mentions in response to the comment below infinitely many solutions for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S^2-T^2=36"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" do exist, also completely inside the domain.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            sqrt(z+10) - sqrt(z+1) is not equal to 3 for any integere z."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sqrt(15+10) - sqrt(15+1) = 1"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"sqrt(0+10) - sqrt(0+1) = sqrt(10) - 1 is less than 3.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

                                            Sir, your reasoning is wrong, base on your calculation the equality required negative value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x,y,z"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to hold.

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S^2-T^2=(S+T)(S-T)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the product rule gives us "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{d(S^2-T^2)}{dx} = 2S\frac{dS}{dx}-2T\frac{dT}{dx} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"At minimum this must be 0, so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{S}{\sqrt{x+2}} = \frac{T}{\sqrt{x+1}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{S^2}{T^2} = \frac{x+2}{x+1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{S^2}{T^2} -1 = \frac{1}{x+1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" 
Doing this for y and z as well we get 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{S^2}{T^2} -1 = \frac{1}{x+1} = \frac{4}{y+1} = \frac{9}{z+1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Introducing a constant k such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1}{k}=\frac{S^2}{T^2} -1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and using the original definition "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T=\sqrt{1+x}+\sqrt{1+y}+\sqrt{1+z}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we can express T at minimum in terms of k:
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T=\sqrt{k}+\sqrt{4k}+\sqrt{9k}=6\sqrt{k}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T^2=36k"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And using the definition for k, we find
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S^2=(\frac{1}{k}+1)T^2=36+36k"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" 
In the difference k does not appear, so we have our answer:"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S^2-T^2=36"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Recall that by QM-AM inequality, for any positive "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a,b "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" , "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \sqrt{\frac{a^2+b^2}{2}} \geq \frac{a+b}{2} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" with equality if and only if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a=b "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned}
\text{let  } \sqrt{x+1} &= a , \sqrt{x+2} = \sqrt{a^2+1} , a>1 \\
\sqrt{y+1} &= b , \sqrt{y+5} = \sqrt{b^2+4} , b>1 \\
\sqrt{z+1} &= c , \sqrt{z+10} = \sqrt{c^2+9}, c>1 \\
\\
S &= \sqrt{a^2+1}+\sqrt{b^2+4}+\sqrt{c^2+9} \\
T &= a+b+c \\
\\
S^2-T^2 &= (\sqrt{a^2+1}+\sqrt{b^2+4}+\sqrt{c^2+9})^2 - T^2 \\
&= 2 \left( \sqrt{\frac{a^2+1^2}{2}}+\sqrt{\frac{b^2+4}{2}}+\sqrt{\frac{c^2+9}{2}} \right)^2 - T^2 \\
&\geq 2 \left( \frac{a+1}{2}+\frac{b+2}{2}+\frac{c+3}{2} \right)^2 - T^2 \\
&= \frac{(a+b+c+6)^2}{2} - (a+b+c)^2
\end{aligned}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"with equality if and only if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=1, b=2, c=3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" , "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\min(S^2-T^2) = \frac{(1+2+3+6)^2}{2} - (1+2+3)^2 = 36"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"note: there is a minor problem , to reach this minimum value, it must be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=1, x=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" but "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x>0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". so this minimum value is unreachable."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"edit: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(x,y,z)=(1,7,17)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" would make it to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"36"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". (thanks to Michael Mendrin)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Used Wolfram alpha to get the following four answers all giving 36 as the local minimum."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"min{(sqrt(x + 2) + sqrt(y + 5) + sqrt(z + 10))^2 - (sqrt(x + 1) + sqrt(y + 1) + sqrt(z + 1))^2|x>0 ∧ y>0 ∧ z>0} = 36 at (x, y, z)≈(0.100514, 3.40206, 8.90463)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"min{(sqrt(x + 2) + sqrt(y + 5) + sqrt(z + 10))^2 - (sqrt(x + 1) + sqrt(y + 1) + sqrt(z + 1))^2|x>0 ∧ y>0 ∧ z>0} = 36 at (x, y, z)≈(0.724565, 5.89826, 14.5211)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"min{(sqrt(x + 2) + sqrt(y + 5) + sqrt(z + 10))^2 - (sqrt(x + 1) + sqrt(y + 1) + sqrt(z + 1))^2|x>0 ∧ y>0 ∧ z>0} = 36 at (x, y, z)≈(0.567207, 5.26883, 13.1049)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"min{(sqrt(x + 2) + sqrt(y + 5) + sqrt(z + 10))^2 - (sqrt(x + 1) + sqrt(y + 1) + sqrt(z + 1))^2|x>0 ∧ y>0 ∧ z>0} = 36 at (x, y, z)≈(0.543924, 5.1757, 12.8953)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"There might be are more such local minimum. I have printed four of them."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Answer=36"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
